metadata.title: CVE-2013-4485 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
389 Directory Server 1.2.11.15 (aka Red Hat Directory Server before8.2.11-14) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service(crash) via multiple @ characters in a GER attribute list in a searchrequest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1').
